attributes.title: Physical Stock Take
attributes.description:
·       A physical inventory count was conducted on 15 March 2025, to verify the accuracy of stock records by comparing actual inventory levels with those recorded in the SAP system. Additionally, the count assessed the effectiveness of internal controls in inventory management.

·       A physical stock count revealed discrepancies as follows:

v  Polybags: Surplus of 230 pieces,

v  Finished Product (Loaves): Shortage of 27 loaves,

v  Yeast: Surplus of 0.15 sachets,

v  White Flour: Surplus of 7.45 kgs,

v  Vegetable Oil (Utto): Surplus of 1.07 kgs/liters.

·       Other raw materials exhibited insignificant variances as illustrated below:

Implication:

·       The discrepancies noted although minor in various stock items indicate potential weaknesses in inventory management processes.

·       Continuous variances especially shortages in finished products and surplus in packing materials could indicate issues such as or process inefficiencies.

While most variances are minimal there is a need to strengthen controls to enhance accuracy and reliability in stock management.
attributes.recommendation:
·       It is recommended that branch management strengthen inventory control measures to correct the identified variances and enhance stock accuracy.

·       A root cause analysis on the discrepancies causes is appropriate to determine reasons for stock variances and implement corrective actions,

value: Will put more effort to reduce the variations even to zero.

·       Noted

It is indicating a small variation in the RM but we will keep maintaining the good control with Minimum variation.

attributes.title: Bread weight analysis.
attributes.description:
·       A spot check was conducted on March 18 2025 to assess compliance with set bread weight standards before dispatch.

·       The objective was to verify whether the packed bread met the required weight specifications.

·       The assessment revealed the following across different varieties

v  Underweight Incidences: The barrel (Bw) bread varieties exhibited significant underweight percentages, with 800g Bw (91%) , 600g Bw (84%)  and 400g Bw (69%)showing the highest deviations.

v  Overweights were noted in 400g Ct (19%) and 600g Ct (21%). For unit 2 this was noted; 400g Ct (59%) and 600g Bt (23%)

v   There were compliance especially in 600g Bt (73%) and 800g Ct (76%) and all other varieties whose average weight was well within the weight standards.

Implication:

·       The presence of underweight bread indicates weaknesses in maintaining consistent dough weights and insufficient monitoring of the production process, particularly in the barrel (Bw) categories.

·       Overweight bread leads to potential financial losses as excess raw materials are used without corresponding revenue gains.

Non-compliance with weight standards can result in regulatory issues, customer dissatisfaction and reputational risks.
attributes.recommendation:
·       The branch management is recommended to Increase supervision in the production process, particularly in the barrel (Bw) categories, to prevent deviations from set standards.

The branch management is also advised to implement stricter monitoring of dough weights at the dividing stage to ensure consistency before baking

value: Will control on each variety to ensure all are in correct weight

·       Despite very low sales of 600Bw and 800Bw underweight was still found this means the manager must ensure to check the dough weight shift wise to prevent the underweight,

However there is good control in other verities.

attributes.title: Mixing chart Analysis
attributes.description:
·       We conducted an analysis of both the mixing chart and mixing chart summaries for the period 13 February -15 March 2025 to determine if the raw materials’ consumption were as per the set BOM and if the expected yield and quality standards were met during production.

·       We noted the following:

ü  Average yield was 191.02 loaves per bag,

ü  Average production was 121 bags equivalent to 80.13% of the set target of 151 bags,

ü  Utto units consumption to bags of flour ratio was 1:1,

ü   228 cases of remixes were observed for the reviewed audit period as detailed in the table below:

Implication:

·       The branch achieved only 80.13% of its daily production target indicating underutilization of production capacity. This suggests an opportunity to improve efficiency and meet production goals more consistently.

·       The low achievement of production targets is attributed to low sales and balance control issues.

The occurrence of remixes was largely due to oven breakdowns which impacted production efficiency.
attributes.recommendation:
·       The maintenance protocols in collaboration with KAF for the ovens should be reviewed and enhanced to minimize breakdowns and decrease the frequency of remix occurrences.

·       A review of the sales strategy by sales representatives is recommended to address the low sales that are hindering production target fulfillment.

value:
·       Target not met due to low sales

Remix was due to oven breakdown

·       The Target were not achieved due to the Low sales and balance control

And remix were seen because of oven breakdown hence it’s affected our production efficiency.

attributes.title: Mini shop Spot Check
attributes.description:
·       A spot check on Mini shop was done on 18 March 2025 to determine if all loaded bread was accounted for and if the sales were equivalent to the till  balances given that the mini-shop did not accept physical cash.

·       All recorded sales at the time of the spot check were accurately accounted for.

·       The expected bread balances after deducting sales from the total loading were physically verified and found to be accurate as detailed below:

Implication:

·       The Mini-Shop's cashless sales process is well-controlled as there were no discrepancies between the sales revenue and the adjusted Mpesa balance.
attributes.recommendation: The management should maintain the Mini shop controls.

value: We will maintain the controls in place.
We will maintain the controls in place.
